From the free-body diagram of the latch D, consider the following forces: kx (The compressive force from the spring), N (The normal force exerted by the lock groove E on the latch D), f1 (The frictional force between the latch D and the lock groove E), f2 (The frictional force between the latch D and the housing A), F (The external force applied to close the door).
In the self-locking state, the door cannot be closed regardless of the external force applied. This means that the forces acting on the latch must balance out such that the latch remains stationary.
